title: AWS IoT GreengrassV2 > AWS IoT GreengrassV2 > AWS IoT GreengrassV2 Overview and Updates
content: To learn more about AWS IoT GreengrassV2, see [how it works](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/greengrass/v2/developerguide/how-it-works.html) and [what's new](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/greengrass/v2/developerguide/greengrass-v2-whats-new.html).
parent_content: To learn more about AWS IoT GreengrassV2, see [how it works](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/greengrass/v2/developerguide/how-it-works.html) and [what's new](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/greengrass/v2/developerguide/greengrass-v2-whats-new.html).

title: AWS IoT GreengrassV2 > AWS IoT GreengrassV2 > Set Up Your Development Environment > Tools Installation (IDEs, Toolchains, SDKs) > RAK7248 Overview and Software Resources
content:
- RAK7248 is based on Raspberry Pi 4 SBC. By default, the latest Raspbian OS based on Linux is used. More information and the available releases can be found [here](https://www.raspberrypi.com/software/).
- RAKwireless provides ready to use image to be flashed on the SD card [here](https://downloads.rakwireless.com/LoRa/AWS_GreengrassV2/RAK7248-AWS-GreengrassV2.zip).
- The main service is the LoRa packet forwarder. It can be found [here](https://github.com/Lora-net/packet_forwarder).
parent_content:
- RAK7248 is based on Raspberry Pi 4 SBC. By default, the latest Raspbian OS based on Linux is used. More information and the available releases can be found [here](https://www.raspberrypi.com/software/).
- RAKwireless provides ready to use image to be flashed on the SD card [here](https://downloads.rakwireless.com/LoRa/AWS_GreengrassV2/RAK7248-AWS-GreengrassV2.zip).
- The main service is the LoRa packet forwarder. It can be found [here](https://github.com/Lora-net/packet_forwarder).

title: AWS IoT GreengrassV2 > AWS IoT GreengrassV2 > Set Up Your Development Environment > Additional Software References > Community Forum Link
AWS IoT GreengrassV2 > AWS IoT GreengrassV2 > Set Up Your Hardware > RAK7248 Interfaces and Specifications
content:
> **Image:** RAK7248 Interfaces  
- A detailed description of components and interfaces can be found in the Datasheet [here](https://docs.rakwireless.com/product-categories/wisgate/rak7248/datasheet/).
- The required power supply is a 5 V/3A USB C that is not included in the package. The device only comes with a USB cable and no adapter. There are no battery options.
- The device has only one LED indicator that flashes green when there is activity.
parent_content:
> **Image:** RAK7248 Interfaces  
- A detailed description of components and interfaces can be found in the Datasheet [here](https://docs.rakwireless.com/product-categories/wisgate/rak7248/datasheet/).
- The required power supply is a 5 V/3A USB C that is not included in the package. The device only comes with a USB cable and no adapter. There are no battery options.
- The device has only one LED indicator that flashes green when there is activity.
- The latest firmware version can be found [here](https://downloads.rakwireless.com/LoRa/RAK7248/Firmware/RAK7248_Latest_Firmware.zip).
- Instructions on how to set up the new firmware can be found [here](https://learn.rakwireless.com/hc/en-us/articles/26744073850775-How-To-Set-Up-WisGate-Developer-Gateway-Firmware).

title: AWS IoT GreengrassV2 > AWS IoT GreengrassV2 > Setup Your AWS Account and Permissions > Set Up AWS Account for RAK7248
content:
Refer to the instructions found at the [Set up your AWS Account](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/iot/latest/developerguide/setting-up.html) guide. Follow the steps outlined in these sections to create your account and a user and get started:  
1. Sign up for an AWS account.
2. Create a user and grant permissions.
3. Open the AWS IoT console.  
**Pay special attention to the Notes.**
parent_content:
Refer to the instructions found at the [Set up your AWS Account](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/iot/latest/developerguide/setting-up.html) guide. Follow the steps outlined in these sections to create your account and a user and get started:  
1. Sign up for an AWS account.
2. Create a user and grant permissions.
3. Open the AWS IoT console.  
**Pay special attention to the Notes.**

title: AWS IoT GreengrassV2 > AWS IoT GreengrassV2 > Create Resources in AWS IoT > Provision AWS IoT Resources for RAK7248
content:
Refer to the instructions found at the [Create AWS IoT Resources](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/iot/latest/developerguide/create-iot-resources.html) guide. Follow the steps outlined in these sections to provision resources for your device:  
1. Create an AWS IoT Policy.
2. Create a thing object.  
**Pay special attention to the Notes.**

title: AWS IoT GreengrassV2 > AWS IoT GreengrassV2 > Install the AWS Command Line Interface > Install and Configure AWS CLI for RAK7248
content: To install the AWS CLI on your host machine, refer to the instructions found at the [Installing the AWS CLI v2](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/userguide/install-cliv2.html) guide. Installing the CLI is needed to complete the instructions in this guide.
parent_content:
To install the AWS CLI on your host machine, refer to the instructions found at the [Installing the AWS CLI v2](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/userguide/install-cliv2.html) guide. Installing the CLI is needed to complete the instructions in this guide.  
Once you have installed AWS CLI, configure it as per the instructions in this [online guide](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/userguide/cli-configure-quickstart.html#cli-configure-quickstart-config). Set the appropriate values for Access key ID, Secret access key, and AWS Region. You can set the output format to "json" if you prefer.

title: AWS IoT GreengrassV2 > AWS IoT GreengrassV2 > Install AWS IoT Greengrass > Flash Raspberry Image to SD Card > Flash RAK7248-AWS-GreengrassV2 Image to SD Card
content:
1. Download the [RAK7248-AWS-GreengrassV2](https://downloads.rakwireless.com/LoRa/AWS_GreengrassV2/RAK7248-AWS-GreengrassV2.zip) image.
2. Download the [balenaEtcher ](https://www.balena.io/etcher/)software. There are options for Windows, macOS, and Linux. Clicking the **Download** button will provide you with the software directly, no installation is required.
3. Flash image to SD Card.  
> **Image:** Flashing Raspberry Pi Image
parent_content:
1. Download the [RAK7248-AWS-GreengrassV2](https://downloads.rakwireless.com/LoRa/AWS_GreengrassV2/RAK7248-AWS-GreengrassV2.zip) image.
2. Download the [balenaEtcher ](https://www.balena.io/etcher/)software. There are options for Windows, macOS, and Linux. Clicking the **Download** button will provide you with the software directly, no installation is required.
3. Flash image to SD Card.  
> **Image:** Flashing Raspberry Pi Image

title: AWS IoT GreengrassV2 > AWS IoT GreengrassV2 > Create a Hello World Component > Greengrass v2 Component Creation and Deployment
content: In Greengrass v2, components can be created on the edge device and uploaded to the cloud, or vice versa.
parent_content: In Greengrass v2, components can be created on the edge device and uploaded to the cloud, or vice versa.

title: AWS IoT GreengrassV2 > AWS IoT GreengrassV2 > Create a Hello World Component > Create the Component on Your Edge Device > Create, Deploy, and Manage a Hello World Component on AWS Greengrass
content: Follow the instructions online under the section [To create a Hello World component](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/greengrass/v2/developerguide/getting-started.html) to create, deploy, test, update and manage a simple component on your device.
parent_content: Follow the instructions online under the section [To create a Hello World component](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/greengrass/v2/developerguide/getting-started.html) to create, deploy, test, update and manage a simple component on your device.

title: AWS IoT GreengrassV2 > AWS IoT GreengrassV2 > Create a Hello World Component > Upload the Hello World Component > Upload Component to AWS Greengrass Cloud [How-To]
content: Follow the instructions online at [Upload your component](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/greengrass/v2/developerguide/getting-started.html) to upload your component to the cloud, where it can be deployed to other devices as needed.
parent_content: Follow the instructions online at [Upload your component](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/greengrass/v2/developerguide/getting-started.html) to upload your component to the cloud, where it can be deployed to other devices as needed.

title: AWS IoT GreengrassV2 > AWS IoT GreengrassV2 > Debugging > Checking Logs for Issues on RAK7248
content: If you experience any issues, you can check the logs located in the **/var/log/** directory.
parent_content: If you experience any issues, you can check the logs located in the **/var/log/** directory.

title: AWS IoT GreengrassV2 > AWS IoT GreengrassV2 > Troubleshooting > Unable to SSH to Device: Connection Checks
content:
If you are unable to ssh to the device:  
1. Check that your Wi-Fi is connected to **RAKWireless_XXXX**.
2. Try ping **192.168.230.1**
parent_content:
If you are unable to ssh to the device:  
1. Check that your Wi-Fi is connected to **RAKWireless_XXXX**.
2. Try ping **192.168.230.1**
